intro: Uvaria macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited uvaria, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by round, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. Its fruit is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor, making it a valuable resource in local cuisines. The plant also has traditional medicinal uses in some Asian countries.
